result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua Jon Nerison was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Sentence w/held probation 2 years - AODA and any follow thru - DNA sample and Surcharge - Fine/costs $979.00 - counts 2 and 3 are dismissed and used as read-in.

miscConds.notes: fine $749.00   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

DNA Surcharge $250.00   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
AODA assessment  within 45 days and follow-through with recommendations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Joshua Jon Nerison in court with attorney Thomas J Duffy.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties stipulate to facts. Defendant entered plea of NC.  Court finds defendant guilty count 1.

COURT:  Count 1 - Sentence w/held probation 2 years - AODA and any follow thru - DNA sample and Surcharge - Fine/costs $979.00 - counts 2 and 3 are dismissed and used as read-in.
Pre-trial - Jury ! 6/2/16 and #2 4/1/16 / Final pretrial 2/3/16
Final pre-trial at 02-03-2016 09:00 am

Attorney Thomas J Duffy in court.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DEF does not appear.  Atty Duffy states DEF called claiming he didn't know he needed to appear in person.  DA allows non-appearance and court approves scheduling of trial dates.

  Final pre-trial scheduled for February 3, 2016 at 09:00 am.  JT #2 scheduled for 4-1-16 @ 8:30 am.  JT #1 scheduled for 6-02-16 @ 8:30 am.
Defendant's Motion for testing by state crime laboratory

Defendant Joshua Jon Nerison in court with attorney Thomas J Duffy.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  10:36 AM  Court calls case and recites appearances.  Request for substitution is not timely.  Atty Duffy waived reading entered plea of not guilty.  Status conference scheduled for November 20, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
Arraignment at 10-05-2015 10:30 am

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign denied

records.addlTxt: of Judge

Attorney Thomas J Duffy in court.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Duffy makes stmt and does not know where his client is.  State will wait 5 minutes to see if he appears.  8:56 back on the record - defendant has failed to appear.  State requests warrant and forfeiture proceedings.  Court warrant ordered - bond forfeiture hearing.  Atty Duffy requests to get off the case.  Court file the proper paperwork.  9:32 AM  Court calls case questions the defendant as to why he was late.  Atty Duffy makes stmt and will waive prelim for today.  Defendant wishes to waive the preliminary exam.  Court advised him that this is his 2nd time he has been late.  Court finds defendant has freely waived his right to a preliminary exam - finds probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.    Warrant quashed bond re-instated
Preliminary hearing at 09-16-2016 08:45 am

Attorney Thomas J Duffy in court.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  1:14 PM  Court calls case and recites appearances.  Atty Duffy makes stmt close to a resolution.  Court makes stmt, no prelim has heard.  Defendant needs to appear.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 16, 2016 at 08:45 am.
Scheduling conference at 09-04-2015 01:15 pm
Submitted application for judicial assignment, as Judge Yackel was the prosecuting attorney on this case prior to being elected.
Preliminary hearing at 08-06-2015 09:30 am

Defendant Joshua Jon Nerison in court by phone  with attorney Thomas J Duffy.  John Martin Yackel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Off the Record - close to resolution, set for prelim  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 7, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Joshua Jon Nerison in court with attorney Thomas J Duffy.  John Martin Yackel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Time limits for preliminary waived.  Bail continues. Scheduling conference scheduled for June 16, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
